long_desc.thetext:
Automate the following tasks: - Download and unpack the release from a web site to a local test machine. - Build all applications. - Build framework api and test. - Run create-application with all templates, various command line options. - Build the skeleton app in all of the ensuing applications.
One result of these activities is the error-free run of the tool chain (usually detectable through shell return codes and the presence of certain script/*.js files). To improve on error checking, the various applications could be started in a browser, but it is much harder to verify correctness of loaded pages.
To 0.8.1 because already assigned. Otherwise please free from the assigner and make target milestone unspecified again.

Daniel, some of this is already addressed by the current solution for continuous integration (bat server / client). What suggestions made here could also be incorporated (please also talk with Thomas for some useful tooling tests)?

Created a test configuration that downloads and unpacks an SDK, creates BOM, GUI and Inline applications and builds them, logging any errors encountered. Subsequently a Selenium test is run on each of the skeleton applications, verifying that the application is loaded correctly and testing basic functionality.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
